source.title: The tale of the fall of Constantinople
source.reference-system: Folio, side and line number from the HM.281, as used as reference line in the interlinear edition
source.editorial-note: We use the East Slavic HM.281. All supralinears have been taken down. All diacritics are stripped off. Letters considered superfluous (in sic tags) by the editor are kept. Editor's additions (in supplied tags) are removed.
source.annotator: Katie Sykes (403 sentences), Lena Borise (286 sentences), Marek Majer (44 sentences), Tatiana Gavrilova (21 sentences), and Hanne Eckhoff (1 sentence)
source.reviewer: Marek Majer (406 sentences), Katie Sykes (334 sentences), and Hanne Eckhoff (15 sentences)
source.electronic-text-title: Tale of the fall of Constantinople
source.electronic-text-version: Interlinear electronic edition based on the Hilandar Monastery Slavic Manuscripts no. 281, 280 and 282. Digitised with the permission of the Hilandar Research Library.

div.title: The foundation of Constantinople in Byzantium
